The "ECDSA" algorithm identifier is used to perform signing and verification using the ECDSA algorithm specified in [X9.62].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "ECDSA".

The NamedCurve type represents named elliptic curves, which are a convenient way to specify the domain parameters of well-known elliptic curves. The following values are recognized:
P-256 NIST recommended curve P-256, also known as secp256r1. P-384 NIST recommended curve P-384, also known as secp384r1. P-521 NIST recommended curve P-521, also known as secp521r1.

dl.dd:
When signing, the following algorithm should be used:
If the type property of key is not a case-sensitive string match for "private", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If any of the properties of EcdsaParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let hashAlgorithm be the hash property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If hashAlgorithm does not describe a registered algorithm that supports the digest operation, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let M be the result of performing the digest operation specified by hashAlgorithm using message.
Let d be the ECDSA private key associated with key.
Let params be the EC domain parameters associated with key.
Perform the ECDSA signing process, as specified in X9.62, Section 7.3, with M as the message, using params as the EC domain parameters, and with d as the private key.
Let r and s be the pair of integers resulting from performing the ECDSA signing process.
Let result be a new ArrayBuffer.
Convert r to a bitstring and append the sequence of bytes to result.
Convert s to a bitstring and append the sequence of bytes to result.
Return result.

When verifying, the following algorithm should be used:
If the type property of key is not a case-sensitive string match for "public", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If any of the properties of EcdsaParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let hashAlgorithm be the hash property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If hashAlgorithm does not describe a registered algorithm that supports the digest operation, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let M be the result of performing the digest operation specified by hashAlgorithm using message.
Let Q be the ECDSA public key associated with key.
Let params be the EC domain parameters associated with key.
Perform the ECDSA verifying process, as specified in X9.62, Section 7.4, with M as the received message, signatire as the received signature and using params as the EC domain parameters, and Q as the public key.
Let result be a boolean indicating whether or not the purported signature is valid, with true indicating the signature is valid and false indicating it is invalid.
Return result.

div.p: TODO: Figure out what to do if "alg" is present on a JWK when importing, as "alg" also (potentially) indicates an inner hash algorithm (e.g. "ES256" indicates a namedCurve of "P-256", but also a hash of "SHA-256"). However, "alg" is optional, and all that is required when importing is a "kty" of "EC". This also requires thinking through the export/wrap case.
This describes using Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) for key generation and key agreement, as specified by X9.63.
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "ECDH".

li.p: If any of the members of EcKeyGenParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Generate an Eliptic Curve key pair, as defined in [X9.63] with domain parameters for the curve identified by the namedCurve property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If performing the operation results in an error: Terminate this algorithm with an error. Otherwise:
Let algorithm be a new EcKeyAlgorithm object.
Set the name property of algorithm to "ECDH".
Set the namedCurve property of algorithm to equal the namedCurve property of normalizedAlgorithm.
Let publicKey be a new Key object representing the public key of the generated key pair.
Set the type property of publicKey to "public"
Set the algorithm property of publicKey to be algorithm.
Set the extractable property of publicKey to true.
Set the usages property of publicKey to be the empty list.
Let privateKey be a new Key object representing the private key of the generated key pair.
Set the type property of privateKey to "private"
Set the algorithm property of privateKey to be algorithm.
Set the extractable property of privateKey to extractable.
Set the usages property of privateKey to be the usage intersection of usages and [ "deriveKey", "deriveBits" ].
Let result be a new KeyPair object.
Set the publicKey property of result to be publicKey.
Set the privateKey property of result to be privateKey.
Return result.
If the type property of key is not a case-sensitive string match for "private", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If any of the members of EcdhKeyDeriveParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let publicKey be the public property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If the name property of the algorithm property of publicKey is not a case-sensitive string match for "ECDH", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the type property of publicKey is not a case-sensitive string match for "public", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the namedCurve property of the algorithm property of publicKey is not equal to the namedCurve property of the algorithm property of key, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Perform the ECDH primitive specified in X9.63 Section 5.4.1 with key as the EC private key d and the EC public key represented by publicKey as the EC public key Q.
If performing the operation results in an error: Terminate this algorithm with an error. Otherwise: Let secret be the result of applying the field element to octet string comversion defined in Section ? of X9.63 to the output of the ECDH primitive.

dl.dd: Return secret

dl.dt: If the length of secret in bits is less than length:
dl.dd: Terminate this algorithm with an error.
Return the first length bits of secret.

dl.dt: If format is a case-sensitive string match for "raw":

li.p: If any of the members of EcKeyImportParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm then terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the namedCurve property of normalizedAlgorithm is not a case-sensitive string match for a named curve, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If usages is not the empty list, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If extractable is false, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let Q be the elliptic curve point on the curve identified by the namedCurve property of normalizedAlgorithm identified by interpreting keyData according to X9.62 Annex A.
Let algorithm be a new EcKeyAlgorithm object.
Set the name property of algorithm to "ECDH".
Set the namedCurve property of algorithm to equal the namedCurve property of normalizedAlgorithm.
Let key be a new Key object.
Set the type property of key to "public"
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the usages property of key to usages.
Set the extractable property of key to extractable.
Return key

dl.dd: Terminate this algorithm with an error.

dl.dt: If format is a case-sensitive string match for "raw":

li.p: If the type property of key is not a case-sensitive string match for "public", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be an octet string representing the Elliptic Curve point Q represented by key according to X9.62 Annex A.
Return a new ArrayBuffer containing data.

dl.dd: Terminate this algorithm with an error.

div.p: This section is non-normative.
The "AES-CTR" algorithm identifier is used to perform encryption and decryption using AES in Counter mode, as described in NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-CTR".

li.p: If any of the members of AesCtrParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the counter property of normalizedAlgorithm does not have length 16 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is zero or is greater than 128, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let ciphertext be the result of performing the CTR Encryption operation described in Section 6.5 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the counter property of normalizedAlgorithm as the initial value of the counter block, the length property of normalizedAlgorithm as the input parameter m to the standard counter block incrementing functon defined in Appendix B.1 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] and plaintext as the input plaintext.
Return ciphertext.
If any of the members of AesCtrParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the counter property of normalizedAlgorithm does not have length 16 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is zero or is greater than 128, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let plaintext be the result of performing the CTR Decryption operation described in Section 6.5 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the counter property of normalizedAlgorithm as the initial value of the counter block, the length property of normalizedAlgorithm as the input parameter m to the standard counter block incrementing functon defined in Appendix B.1 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] and ciphertext as the input ciphertext.
Return plaintext.
If any of the members of AesKeyGenParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is not equal to one of 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If usages contains any entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.

Generate an AES key of length equal to the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If the key generation step fails: Terminate this algorithm with an error Otherwise:
Let key be a new Key object representing the generated AES key.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CTR".
Set the length property of algorithm to equal the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to be extractable.
Set the usages property of key to be usages.
Return key.
If usages contains an entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string contained in keyData.
If the length in bits of data is not 128, 192 or 256 then terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let jwk be the result of running the parse a jwk algorithm over keyData.
If the "kty" field of jwk is not a case-sensitive string match to "oct", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If jwk does not meet the requirements of Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string obtained by decoding the "k" field of jwk.

dl.dd: If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A128CTR", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A192CTR", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A256CTR", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: If the "use" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "enc", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "key_ops" field of jwk is present, and is invalid according to the requirements of JSON Web Key or does not contain all of the specified usages values, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "ext" field of jwk is present and has the value false and extractable is true, terminate this algorithm with an error.

dl.dd: Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: Let key be a new Key object representing an AES key with value data.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CTR".
Set the length property of algorithm to the length, in bits, of data.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to extractable.
Set the usages property of key to the normalized value of usages.
Return key.

dl.dd: Let data be the raw octets of the key represented by key.

li.p: Let jwk be a new internal object.
Set the kty property of jwk to the string "oct".
Set the k property of jwk to be a string containng the raw octets of the key represented by key, encoded according to Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms.

dl.dt: If the length property of key is 128:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A128CTR".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 192:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A192CTR".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 256:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A256CTR".

li.p: Set the key_ops property of jwk to equal the usages property of key.
Set the ext property of jwk to equal the extractable property of key.
Let stringifiedJwk be the result of encoding jwk into a string according to the grammer specified in Section 15.12 of ECMA262.
Let data be the UTF-8 encoding of stringifiedJwk.
Let keyData be a new ArrayBuffer containing data.
Return data.
If any of the members of AesDerivedKeyParams are not present in normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm is not 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Return the length property of normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm.

div.p: This section is non-normative.
The "AES-CBC" algorithm identifier is used to perform encryption and decryption using AES in Cipher Block Chaining mode, as described in NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A].

When operating in CBC mode, messages that are not exact multiples of the AES block size (16 bytes) can be padded under a variety of padding schemes. In the Web Crypto API, the only padding mode that is supported is that of PKCS#7, as described by Section 10.3, step 2, of RFC 2315 [RFC2315].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-CBC".

li.p: If any of the members of AesCbcParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm does not have length 16 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let padded-plaintext be the result of adding padding octets to ciphertext according to the procedure defined in Section 10.3 of RFC 2315 [RFC2315], step 2, with a value of k of 16.

Let ciphertext be the result of performing the CBC Encryption operation described in Section 6.2 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm as the IV input parameter and padded-plaintext as the input plaintext.
Return ciphertext.
If any of the members of AesCbcParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm does not have length 16 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let padded-plaintext be the result of performing the CBC Decryption operation described in Section 6.2 of NIST SP 800-38A [SP800-38A] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm as the IV input parameter and ciphertext as the input ciphertext.
Let p be the value of the last octet of padded-plaintext.
If p is zero or greater than 16, or if any of the last p octets of padded-plaintext have a value which is not p, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let plaintext be the result of removing p octents from the end of padded-plaintext.
Return plaintext.
If any of the members of AesKeyGenParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is not equal to one of 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If usages contains any entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.

Generate an AES key of length equal to the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If the key generation step fails: Terminate this algorithm with an error Otherwise:
Let key be a new Key object representing the generated AES key.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CBC".
Set the length property of algorithm to equal the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to be extractable.
Set the usages property of key to be usages.
Return key.
If usages contains an entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string contained in keyData.
If the length in bits of data is not 128, 192 or 256 then terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let jwk be the result of running the parse a jwk algorithm over keyData.
If the "kty" field of jwk is not a case-sensitive string match to "oct", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If jwk does not meet the requirements of Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string obtained by decoding the "k" field of jwk.

dl.dd: If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A128CBC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A192CBC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A256CBC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: If the "use" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "enc", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "key_ops" field of jwk is present, and is invalid according to the requirements of JSON Web Key or does not contain all of the specified usages values, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "ext" field of jwk is present and has the value false and extractable is true, terminate this algorithm with an error.

dl.dd: Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: Let key be a new Key object representing an AES key with value data.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CBC".
Set the length property of algorithm to the length, in bits, of data.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to extractable.
Set the usages property of key to the normalized value of usages.
Return key.

dl.dd: Let data be the raw octets of the key represented by key.

li.p: Let jwk be a new internal object.
Set the kty property of jwk to the string "oct".
Set the k property of jwk to be a string containng the raw octets of the key represented by key, encoded according to Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms.

dl.dt: If the length property of key is 128:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A128CBC".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 192:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A192CBC".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 256:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A256CBC".

li.p: Set the key_ops property of jwk to equal the usages property of key.
Set the ext property of jwk to equal the extractable property of key.
Let stringifiedJwk be the result of encoding jwk into a string according to the grammer specified in Section 15.12 of ECMA262.
Let data be the UTF-8 encoding of stringifiedJwk.
Let keyData be a new ArrayBuffer containing data.
Return data.
If any of the members of AesDerivedKeyParams are not present in normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm is not 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Return the length property of normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm.

div.p: This section is non-normative.
The "AES-CMAC" algorithm identifier is used to perform message authentication using AES with a cipher-based MAC, as described in NIST SP 800-38B [SP800-38B].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-CMAC".

li.p: Let length equal the length property of normalizedAlgorithm, if present, and 128 otherwise.
If length is zero or greater than 128, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let mac be the result of performing the MAC Generation operation described in Section 6.2 of NIST SP 800-38B [SP800-38B] using AES as the block cipher, length as the value of the MAC length parameter, Tlen, and message as the message, M.
Return mac.
Let length equal the length property of normalizedAlgorithm, if present, and 128 otherwise.
If length is zero or greater than 128, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let ouput be the result of performing the MAC Verification operation described in Section 6.3 of NIST SP 800-38B [SP800-38B] using AES as the block cipher, length as the value of the MAC length parameter, Tlen, message as the message, M and signature as the received MAC, T'.
Return true if output is VALID and false otherwise.
If any of the members of AesKeyGenParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is not equal to one of 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If usages contains any entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for "sign" or "verify", terminate this algorithm with an error.

Generate an AES key of length equal to the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If the key generation step fails: Terminate this algorithm with an error Otherwise:
Let key be a new Key object representing the generated AES key.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CMAC".
Set the length property of algorithm to equal the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to be extractable.
Set the usages property of key to be usages.
Return key.
If usages contains an entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for "sign" or "verify", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string contained in keyData.
If the length in bits of data is not 128, 192 or 256 then terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let jwk be the result of running the parse a jwk algorithm over keyData.
If the "kty" field of jwk is not a case-sensitive string match to "oct", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If jwk does not meet the requirements of Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string obtained by decoding the "k" field of jwk.

dl.dd: If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A128CMAC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A192CMAC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A256CMAC", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: If the "use" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "enc", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "key_ops" field of jwk is present, and is invalid according to the requirements of JSON Web Key or does not contain all of the specified usages values, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "ext" field of jwk is present and has the value false and extractable is true, terminate this algorithm with an error.

dl.dd: Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: Let key be a new Key object representing an AES key with value data.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-CMAC".
Set the length property of algorithm to the length, in bits, of data.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to extractable.
Set the usages property of key to the normalized value of usages.
Return key.

dl.dd: Let data be the raw octets of the key represented by key.

li.p: Let jwk be a new internal object.
Set the kty property of jwk to the string "oct".
Set the k property of jwk to be a string containng the raw octets of the key represented by key, encoded according to Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms.

dl.dt: If the length property of key is 128:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A128CMAC".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 192:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A192CMAC".
dl.dt: If the length property of key is 256:
dl.dd: Set the alg property of jwk to the string "A256CMAC".

li.p: Set the key_ops property of jwk to equal the usages property of key.
Set the ext property of jwk to equal the extractable property of key.
Let stringifiedJwk be the result of encoding jwk into a string according to the grammer specified in Section 15.12 of ECMA262.
Let data be the UTF-8 encoding of stringifiedJwk.
Return a new ArrayBuffer containing data.
If any of the members of AesDerivedKeyParams are not present in normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm is not 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Return the length property of normalizedDerivedKeyAlgorithm.

div.p: This section is non-normative.
The "AES-GCM" algorithm identifier is used to perform authenticated encryption and decryption using AES in Galois/Counter Mode mode, as described in NIST SP 800-38D [SP800-38D].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "AES-GCM".

li.p: If the iv property of AesGcmParams is not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If plaintext has a length greater than 2^39 - 256 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm has a length greater than 2^64 - 1 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the additionalData property of normalizedAlgorithm is present, is not null and has a length greater than 2^64 - 1 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.

dl.dt: If the tagLength property of normalizedAlgorithm is not present or is null:
dl.dd: Let tagLength be 128.
dl.dt: If the tagLength property of normalizedAlgorithm is one of 32, 64, 96, 104, 112, 120 or 128:
dl.dd: Let tagLength be equal to the tagLength property of normalizedAlgorithm
Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: Let additionalData be the contents of the additionalData property of normalizedAlgorithm if present and not null and the empty octet string otherwise.

Let C and T be the outputs that result from performing the Authenticated Encryption Function described in Section 7.1 of NIST SP 800-38D [SP800-38D] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm as the IV input parameter, additionalData as the A input parameter, tagLength as the t pre-requisite and plaintext as the input plaintext.
Return a new ArrayBuffer containing C | T where '|' denotes concatenation.
If the iv property of AesGcmParams is not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.

dl.dt: If the tagLength property of normalizedAlgorithm is not present or null:
dl.dd: Let tagLength be 128.
dl.dt: If the tagLength property of normalizedAlgorithm is one of 32, 64, 96, 104, 112, 120 or 128:
dl.dd: Let tagLength be equal to the tagLength property of normalizedAlgorithm
Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: If plaintext has a length less than tagLength bits, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm has a length greater than 2^64 - 1 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the additionalData property of normalizedAlgorithm is present, is not null and has a length greater than 2^64 - 1 bytes, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let tag be the last tagLength bits of ciphertext.
Let actualCiphertext be the result of removing the last tagLength bits from ciphertext.
Let additionalData be the contents of the additionalData property of normalizedAlgorithm if present and not null and the empty octet string otherwise.

Perform the Authenticated Decryption Function described in Section 7.2 of NIST SP 800-38D [SP800-38D] using AES as the block cipher, the contents of the iv property of normalizedAlgorithm as the IV input parameter, additionalData as the A input parameter, tagLength as the t pre-requisite, actualCiphertext as the input ciphertext, C and tag as the authentation tag, T.
If the result of the algorithm is the indication of inauthenticity, "FAIL": Terminate this algorithm with an error. Otherwise: Let plaintext be the output P of the Authenticated Decryption Function.
Return a new ArrayBuffer containing plaintext.
If any of the members of AesKeyGenParams are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the length property of normalizedAlgorithm is not equal to one of 128, 192 or 256, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If usages contains any entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.

Generate an AES key of length equal to the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
If the key generation step fails: Terminate this algorithm with an error Otherwise:
Let key be a new Key object representing the generated AES key.
Let algorithm be a new AesKeyAlgorithm.
Set the name property of algorithm to "AES-GCM".
Set the length property of algorithm to equal the length property of normalizedAlgorithm.
Set the algorithm property of key to algorithm.
Set the extractable property of key to be extractable.
Set the usages property of key to be usages.
Return key.
If usages contains an entry which is not a case-sensitive string match for one of "encrypt", "decrypt", "wrapKey" or "unwrapKey", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string contained in keyData.
If the length in bits of data is not 128, 192 or 256 then terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let jwk be the result of running the parse a jwk algorithm over keyData.
If the "kty" field of jwk is not a case-sensitive string match to "oct", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If jwk does not meet the requirements of Section 6.4 of JSON Web Algorithms, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Let data be the octet string obtained by decoding the "k" field of jwk.

dl.dd: If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A128GCM", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A192GCM", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "alg" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "A256GCM", terminate this algorithm with an error.
Terminate this algorithm with an error.

li.p: If the "use" field of jwk is present, and is not a case-sensitive string match to "enc", terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "key_ops" field of jwk is present, and is invalid according to the requirements of JSON Web Key or does not contain all of the specified usages values, terminate this algorithm with an error.
If the "ext" field of jwk is present and has the value false and extractable is true, terminate this algorithm with an error.

This describes using Diffie-Hellman for key generation and key agreement, as specified by PKCS #3.
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "DH".

Let algorithm be a new DhKeyAlgorithm object.
Set the name property of algorithm to "DH".
Set the prime property of algorithm to equal the prime property of normalizedAlgorithm.

Set the algorithm property of publicKey to be algorithm.

Set the type property of privateKey to "private"
Set the algorithm property of privateKey to be algorithm.
Set the extractable property of privateKey to extractable.
Set the usages property of privateKey to be usages.
Let result be a new KeyPair object.
Set the publicKey property of result to be publicKey.
Set the privateKey property of result to be privateKey.
Return result.

div.p: Since this algorithm is based on PKCS#3, import/export in X9.42 form, as specified in X.509/RFC 3279 is not supported [PKCS#3 uses only prime/p and base/g as parameters, wheras X9.42 adds a further value q].

The SHA-384 algorithm as specified in Section 6.5
The SHA-512 algorithm as specified in Section 6.4

dl.dt: If the name property of normalizedAlgorithm is a cases-sensitve string match for "SHA-1":
dl.dd: Let result be the result of performing the SHA-1 hash function defined in Section 6.1 of [FIPS PUB 180-4] using message as the input message, M.
dl.dt: If the name property of normalizedAlgorithm is a cases-sensitve string match for "SHA-224":
dl.dd: Let result be the result of performing the SHA-224 hash function defined in Section 6.3 of [FIPS PUB 180-4] using message as the input message, M.
dl.dt: If the name property of normalizedAlgorithm is a cases-sensitve string match for "SHA-256":
dl.dd: Let result be the result of performing the SHA-256 hash function defined in Section 6.2 of [FIPS PUB 180-4] using message as the input message, M.
dl.dt: If the name property of normalizedAlgorithm is a cases-sensitve string match for "SHA-384":
dl.dd: Let result be the result of performing the SHA-384 hash function defined in Section 6.5 of [FIPS PUB 180-4] using message as the input message, M.
dl.dt: If the name property of normalizedAlgorithm is a cases-sensitve string match for "SHA-512":
dl.dd: Let result be the result of performing the SHA-1 hash function defined in Section 6.4 of [FIPS PUB 180-4] using message as the input message, M.

li.p: Return a new ArrayBuffer containing result.

div.p: The "CONCAT" algorithm identifier is used to perform key derivation using the key derivation algorithm defined in Section 5.8.1 of NIST SP 800-56A [SP800-56A].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "CONCAT".

li.p: If any of the hash, algorithmId, partyUInfo or partyVInfo properties are not present in normalizedAlgorithm, terminate this algorithm with an error.

Let secret be the result of performing the Concatenation Key Derivation Funtion defined in Section 5.8.1 of [SP800-56A] with length as keydatalen, the hash function identified by the hash property of normalizedAlgorithm as H, the algorithmId property of normalizedAlgorithm as AlgorithmID, the partyUInfo property of normalizedAlgorithm as PartyUInfo, the partyVInfo property of normalizedAlgorithm as PartyVInfo, the publicInfo property of normalizedAlgorithm, if present and not null, as publicInfo and the privateInfo property of normalizedAlgorithm, if present and not null, as privateInfo.
If the operation fails, terminate this algorithm with an error.
Return secret

div.p: This section is non-normative.

The "HKDF-CTR" algorithm identifier is used to perform key derivation using the algorithm described in RFC 5869 [RFC5869] and NIST SP 800-56C [SP800-56C], using HMAC in counter mode, as described in Section 5.1 of NIST SP 800-108 [SP800-108].
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "HKDF-CTR".

The definition of HKDF allows the caller to supply an optional pseudorandom salt value, which is used as the key during the extract phase. If this value is not supplied, an all zero string is used instead. However, support for an explicit salt value is not widely implemented in existing APIs, nor is it required by existing usages of HKDF. Should this be an optional parameter, and if so, what should the behaviour be of a user agent that does not support explicit salt values (is it conforming or non-conforming?)
The recognized algorithm name for this algorithm is "PBKDF2".

In the above snippet, password is an optional field. The intent is that conforming user agents MAY support applications that wish to use PBKDF2 by providing password entry via an un-spoofable (by the web application) UI.

The AlgorithmIdentifier typedef permits algorithms to be specified as either a dictionary or a DOMString. In order to ensure consistency, conforming user agents must normalize all AlgorithmIdentifier inputs into a single, canonical form. When normalization is indicated, it must act as follows:

ol.li: Let O be the AlgorithmIdentifier to be normalized.
Let result be the normalized output.

If O is a DOMString, then:
If O contains any non-ASCII characters, throw a SyntaxError and return from this algorithm.
Convert every character in O to lower case.
If O contains a recognized algorithm alias then let result be re-initialized to the aliased dictionary and this algorithm restarted, using result as the input to be normalized.
Otherwise, terminate this algorithm with an error.

For each key K in O with an associated value V:
If the associated value V is an AlgorithmIdentifier, set the associated value for K in result to be the result of executing the algorithm normalization rules.
If the associated value V is a dictionary, set the associated value for K in result to be the result of executing this algorithm recursively for every value in the dictionary.
Otherwise, let the associated value for key K in result be the associated value for key K in O.

div.p: WARNING: This section is broken for purpose. Further, normalization at this degree is is no longer required, as the algorithm is never reflected back to the caller. Instead, specify how specific algorithms can/should validate the parameters - and how to perform DOMString substitutions.

div.h2: Mapping between JSON Web Key / JSON Web Algorithm
div.p: The following section is non-normative. Refer to algorithm-specific sections for the normative requirements of importing and exporting JWK.
Should the following be specified.

li.p: RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 with SHA-1
RSA-PSS with SHA-1
RSA-OAEP needs specifiers for the hash algorithms.
ECDSA with SHA-1
ECDSA where the curve (P-256, P-384, P-521) is not aligned with the hash (SHA-256, SHA-384, SHA-512)

div.p: The following section is non-normative. Refer to algorithm-specific sections for the normative requirements of importing and exporting SPKI.

The handling of "id-RSASSA-PSS" and "id-RSAES-OAEP" are tricky. RFC 5756 recommends implementations should not include parameters when PSS is used with a subjectPublicKeyInfo, and MUST NOT include parameters when OAEP is used. However, when OAEP is used as part of a key transport (as an AlgorithmIdentifier), implementations MUST include the parameters.
The natural conflict is in deciding when a key is being exported as part of a subjectPublicKeyInfo (which is what "spki" implies) and when it's being used as an algorithmIdentifier for transport.

div.h2: Mapping between Algorithm and PKCS#8 PrivateKeyInfo
div.p: The following section is non-normative. Refer to algorithm-specific sections for the normative requirements of importing and exporting PKCS#8 PrivateKeyInfo.
There does not appear to be a normative reference for a DH key being encoded as an INTEGER. Only RFC 5958 seems to mention this.
